sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This is Euronews Now. I'm Helena Humphrey. Here are your top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Russia rejects calls to demilitarize the Zaporizhia nuclear power plant after the UN calls for an urgent end of military activity to prevent a potential disaster.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Serbia and Kosovo fail to reach an agreement on easing tensions between the two countries at talks mediated by the EU foreign policy chief.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And Finland's prime minister is in trouble for having too much fun. Opposition parties want her to take a drug test after a video emerged of her partying with friends.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: the UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres met in Lviv, with the Zaporozhian nuclear power plant top of the agenda.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Erdogan conveyed a message on behalf of Russia, saying it is ready to negotiate peace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Zelensky, however, was skeptical of this.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I am very surprised that they are ready for some kind of peace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: People who kill, rape, hit our civilian cities with cruise missiles every day cannot want peace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: They should first leave our territory, then we will see.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Another important issue is grain, with the UN Secretary General wanting to speed up humanitarian shipments of Ukrainian cereals.

sentences.sentence: We have seen signs that global food markets are beginning to stabilize.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But let's have no illusions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Supply chains are still disrupted and energy and transportation costs remain unacceptably high." But the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant was the main point of discussion, with Gutierrez calling for an urgent withdrawal of military activity.

sentences.sentence: Turkey is exerting its influence to end the conflict through a diplomatic solution, as it has stood, and will continue to stand by our Ukrainian friends.

sentences.sentence: Ankara has tried to keep a balanced position in this conflict, supplying arms to Ukraine while also not supporting Western sanctions opposed on Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: On Thursday, Kyiv and Ankara signed an agreement on the reconstruction of infrastructure destroyed by Russian bombing. The aftermath of two separate Russian attacks on the city of Kharkiv in northeastern Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: With at least 17 people confirmed dead, the search continues for survivors following the rocket strikes on Wednesday through to Thursday morning.

A day of mourning will be declared in the city Ukraine's president Vladimir Zelensky has condemned the attacks on the country's second largest city as a cynical strike on civilians with no justification for its part Russia claims it targeted a temporary base of foreign mercenaries killing 90 of them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, local authorities say two Russian villages were evacuated yesterday after a fire broke out at an ammunition depot near the border with Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The blaze comes days after explosions at a military base and munitions depot in a next Crimea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And Russia says it's deployed warplanes armed with state-of-the-art hypersonic missiles to the country's Kaliningrad region, an enclave surrounded by two NATO nations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: As tensions rise between Serbia and Kosovo, the European Union has been trying to play mediator, but to no avail.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A meeting yesterday between EU foreign policy chief Joseph Borrell and leaders from the two nations ended without reaching an agreement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Borrell says it's important for the two nations to normalize their relations, particularly given the current context.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: normalize their relations, particularly given the current context. And this happened at the moment when we are in a critical time for Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We are facing a dramatic and very dangerous moment for our continent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And this is not a moment for increasing tensions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It is time for looking for solutions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Before meeting with Borrell, the two leaders met separately with NATO leader Jens Stoltenberg. The latest tension follows Kosovo's decision that Serbian identity documents and vehicle license plates would no longer be valid in its territory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Belgrade has been implementing the same measures for people from Kosovo crossing into Serbia for years, saying accepting them would amount to recognizing its neighbor as an independent state.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Serbia still refuses to recognize Kosovo's independence declared in 2008.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We're marching to Belgrade because we want to ask Mr. Milosevic kindly to leave. Finland's Prime Minister, Sena Marin, has defended her private life after a video emerged of her at a party with friends.

Rushdie who was airlifted to hospital survived the incident but suffered life-changing injuries. A federal judge in the United

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: States says he's leaning towards releasing part of an affidavit justifying an FBI search last week of former President Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago estate. He says it's the government's task to show why an edited version of the document should not be released, and has given the Department of Justice one week to suggest which parts of it should be cut out. This follows an application by several news organizations to unseal additional records because of high public interest in the case.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Federal prosecutors looking into whether Trump illegally removed classified and sensitive government records after leaving office want the affidavit to remain sealed, arguing it could compromise the investigation and discourage witness cooperation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Trump has called for the release of the unredacted affidavit, saying it would be in the interests of what he described as transparency.

sentences.sentence: The Trump Organization's longtime chief financial officer, Alan Weisselberg,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: leaving a New York court on Thursday after pleading guilty to 15 counts of felony tax fraud.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Seventy-five-year-old Weisselberg will serve five months in prison and has agreed to testify truthfully at the criminal trial of former U.S. President Donald Trump's real estate company in October.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: He has, however, refused to cooperate with prosecutors or testify against Donald Trump personally.
